result.execSummary:
The defendant Malik T Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 01-18-2018. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay the applicable DNA surcharge.
Court WAIVES all non mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

Credit for 12 days. 

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of sentence.
Review hearing scheduled for 01-18-2018 at 1:30 pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malik T Wallace

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation; received and filed.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Case in court for review hearing in reference to expungement.  Defendant have a pending felony case.  Defense remove request for expungement.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of sentence

Defendant Malik T Wallace in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Andrea L. Fendry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 12 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit of 12 DAYS time served.  
Defendant ordered to complete 20 hours of community service.  

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges by January 18, 2018.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank, and pay the applicable DNA surcharge. 

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of sentence. 

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Review hearing scheduled for January 18, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Malik T Wallace in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant has a pending felony case scheduled for jury trial on 6-05-2017. Defense requests to adjourn this case after trial. State has no objection. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Malik T Wallace in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William P Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Malik T Wallace in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William P Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense needs to obtain Discovery from prior counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.
  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Malik T Wallace in court.  William P Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
There has been no attorney by the Public Defenders office appointed. After communication with the PD's office, Attorney William Rakestraw has been appointed and will be present on the next court date. Court orders case adjourned for status conference in branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malik T Wallace in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Defense counsel has obtained other employment and case has not been appointed new counsel. Defendant will be appointed new counsel through the public defenders office. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in Branch 4.
  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Malik T Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Conference held in chambers.  Motion hearing proceeded.  Arguments heard.  Court grants defense motion for proposed jury instruction as revised in element 3.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
in Support of Defendant's Proposed Jury Instruction, filed.

Filed:
*  State's Motion in Limine.

Case recalled. Appearances: Malik Wallace with attorney Gabriela Leija in court. William Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Further arguments placed on the record. Court orders adjournment for numerous legal issues which must be determined prior to commencement of trial. Court orders motions in limine and brief of jury instructions filed by September 15, 2016, responses due September 9-29-2016 and reply due by October 13, 2016.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Case recalled. Appearances: Defendant Malik Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela Leija and attorney Robert Hampton. William Dockry and Ian Vance- Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion placed on the record on motion in limine and proposed jury instruction. Jury panel in court. Juror sworn for voir dire at the hour of 11:38 am. Court instructed jury and released for lunch. Jury out of box 12:00 pm. Additional arguments placed on the record. Case passed until 1:30 pm.

Defendant Malik T Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calendared for jury trial. First call. Defense ready to proceed with jury trial. State ready to proceed. Case passed to address calendar.
Received and filed: Defendant's proposed jury instructions.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties ready to proceed to trial. Case passed.
Recalled at 10:33.
Court will be in trial on another matter and ordered this case adjourned.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Michael Hanrahan, Branch 4 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for bail/bond hearing.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  No issues remain.  Case remains calendared for jury trial in Branch 21.  Court ordered 5/20/16 status date vacated.
16RM025190  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 05/01/16
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Malik J Wallace in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 5814 North 92nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. Court does not forfeit any bail.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 4/14/2016.  Calendar call scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriel Leija in court requesting to adjourn Jury trial scheduled for 4/11/2016 to 5/25/2016 at 1:30pm.  State does not Object. 
Court ordered case  adjourned for Status on 4-11-2016 at 8:30am. 
Court ordered case  adjourned for Jury Trial on 5/25/2016 at 8:30am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn, received and filed.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State will revoke its offer.  Jury trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Leija in trial before Judge Rosa.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense that parties have reached a resolution.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Jury trial date of 2-15-2016 ordered vacated.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript (33 pages) MOTION HEARING commencing OCTOBER 28, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Motion Proceeded.  
Sworn for the State:  Officer David Grycowski, MPD.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments made by the State and defense.  Based on all filings, testimony and evidence in court, the court DENIED defense motion. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the State's request for an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion Challenging the Stop and Seizure of the Defendant.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference. Defense counsel wishes to proceed with motion. Motion to be filed with the state and defense by 5:00 PM on 8/12/2015. Case remains set for Motion Hearing on 8/24/2015 at 1:30 PM.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Malik J Wallace not in court, in custody.  Morgan Wills, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending felony case and requests another status conference date. No objection from the state. 

Back on the record 11:41:05

Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Malik J Wallace in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Malik J Wallace in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
